alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 28 at 11:23PM PST until March 01 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Heaviest tonight. Snow total of 10 to 20 inches with local amounts to 30 inches, highest in the eastern San Gabriel mountains. Southwest to west winds 25 to 40 mph with gusts between 50 mph and 60 mph through late tonight shifting to the west to northwest 15 to 30 mph with gusts to 45 mph. * WHERE...Ventura County Mountains, Los Angeles County Mountains and Santa Barbara County Interior Mountains. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible due to reduced visibility due to snow and blowing snow. Mountain roads, including higher portions of Interstate 5 will likely be impacted at times. Snow drifts, especially above 5000 feet, may be another substantial travel hazard. The weight of recent snow combined with strong winds may down trees and powerlines.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions from CalTrans are available by calling 1 800 4 2 7 7 6 2 3.
